description: Tenant reports a heating issue; the assistant verifies the lease, opens a high‑priority maintenance ticket, and schedules a repair appointment.

messages.content: You are RentWise Assistant, an AI‑driven rental‑management agent. Use the provided tools to retrieve lease agreements, manage maintenance tickets, schedule repairs, and communicate clearly with tenants and property managers.
Hi, the heating in my unit (Apartment 3B, property ID PROP123) stopped working this morning. It's freezing inside. Can you help?
I’m sorry to hear that you’re without heat. Let me pull up your lease to confirm the unit details and then I’ll open a maintenance ticket for you.

Lease Agreement for Property PROP123, Tenant TEN456:

Tenant Name: Jane Doe
Unit: 3B
Lease Start: 2024-06-01
Lease End: 2025-05-31
Rent: $1,200/month
Utilities: Included (Heating, Water, Electricity)

[Link to full PDF lease: https://example.com/leases/PROP123_TEN456.pdf]

Thank you, Jane. I’ve created a high‑priority maintenance ticket (ID **MT-7890**) for the heating problem in unit 3B. I’ll now schedule a repair for tomorrow morning.

Would you like me to confirm the appointment for **2025-12-09 at 10:00 AM**?
Repair scheduled: Ticket MT-7890 will be attended by contractor CONTRACTOR_42 on 2025-12-09 at 10:00 AM. Confirmation ID: SCH-1122.

Your heating repair is confirmed for **December 9th at 10 AM**. The contractor (ID: CONTRACTOR_42) will be there to fix the issue. If anything changes or you need to reschedule, just let me know. Stay warm!
